Born in Hualien, the sisters Beatrice Long and Christina Long will present a splendid piano duet with their outstanding piano playing skills and seamless cooperation at the concert hall of the College of The Arts at National Dong Hwa University!

Beatrice Long and Christina Long, who have previously won the first prize at the Ellis Duo Piano Competition in the United States and the Best Performance Award for American Modern Works, will bring a delightful feast of pianos. They will express the background of each piece in the concert with different styles of music. Through music, composers convey the spirit of overcoming challenging times, whether it's Debussy's "White and Black" and Messiaen's "Amende Anges,des Saints,du chant des oiseaux" expressing the ravages of war, or Rachmaninoff's pieces of music expressing the loss of loved and the taste of failure (Suite No.2). And after the humor in Paul Schoenfeld's "Boogie" , the music reflects the hope in despair.

Despite facing darkness, they revive their dedication to beautiful music, and using creativity as the driving force to move forward. It is believed that after the pandemic, these masterpieces will have an even more special significance.

Everyone is invited to come to the Concert Hall of the College of Arts on 12/18 to listen to this exciting piano duet performance, where the brilliance can only be presented through the tacit understanding between the two players !
